overview:
Christopher co-founded EquaMetrics Inc., a New York-based financial technology firm that specializes in algorithmic and high frequency trading applications.

Chris is a New York City based entrepreneur. He was raised in Litchfield, Connecticut and Palm Beach, Florida before serving in the United States Navy and graduating from Harvard, where he was a Government concentrator and played as Flanker or Lock for the Harvard Rugby Football Club.

Since graduating, Chris moved to the City and co-founded EquaMetrics Inc., a financial technology firm that specializes in algorithmic and high-frequency trading applications. EquaMetrics Inc. completed $1.5M Seed Capital round at a $10M post-money valuation to start the company, which it used to open its Manhattan office and hire its staff of highly educated engineers that develop its patent-pending technology. Its domestic sales cycle will begin in July 2012, while it has plans to open its second sales office in Shanghai, China during the first quarter of 2013.

In addition to this, he is a 2012 candidate for a post-graduate diploma in Management through the London School of Economics & Political Sciences’ International Program and a board member of several private and not-for-profit organizations. He stays active by playing squash several times a week and hockey with a league at Chelsea Piers.
